results.hadith: وخير الهدي هدي محمد ﷺ
results.context: Opening remarks of a sermon or lecture.
results.explanation: The best guidance is the guidance of Muhammad (peace be upon him).

results.hadith: لأسن سُنَّة حسنة، وإنْ سبقني إليها غيري فأنا أُحييها
results.context: The author is explaining why he included a large number of names of contributors in the book's acknowledgements.
results.explanation: The author states his intention to establish a good practice, and if others have done it before, he is reviving it.

results.hadith: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن رَّكَّهَا وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّمَهَا
results.context: The text presents this as a saying related to the topic of scientific work and its proper attribution.
results.explanation: This is a saying that translates to: "He has succeeded who has purified it, and he has failed who has corrupted it."

results.hadith: أين تحري الحلال، والبعد عن المشتبهات؟
results.context: The text is discussing the importance of seeking halal and avoiding the doubtful.
results.explanation: This is a rhetorical question emphasizing the importance of seeking what is permissible (halal) and avoiding the doubtful matters.

results.hadith: أين درء المفاسد وسد الذرائع؟
results.context: The text is discussing the importance of preventing harm and blocking the means to evil.
results.explanation: This is a rhetorical question emphasizing the importance of preventing harm and blocking the means to evil.

results.hadith: ولا يزال الرجل يكذب ويتحرى الكذب حتى يكتب عِند اللهِ كذابًا
results.context: The text discusses the characteristics of someone who lies frequently.
results.explanation: A person who continually lies and seeks out falsehood will eventually be recorded as a liar in the sight of Allah.

results.hadith: هو علم الحديث الشريف الذي تُعرف به جوامع الكلم، وتنفجر منه ينابيع الحكم وتدور عليه رحى الشر ع بالأثر، وهو ملاك كل أمر ونهي
results.context: Describing the importance of the science of hadith.
results.explanation: This section highlights the importance of the science of hadith, emphasizing its role in understanding the Prophet's concise and comprehensive speech, the sources of wisdom, and the basis for all commands and prohibitions.

results.hadith: كيف وهو كلام رسول اللّ 䋦، والرسول أشرف الخلق كلهم أجمعين .. وهو تلو كلام الله تعالى، وثاني أدلة الأحكام
results.context: Further emphasizing the importance of hadith.
results.explanation: This part emphasizes the importance of the Prophet's words (hadith), highlighting that they are second only to the words of Allah (Quran) and are a primary source of legal rulings.

results.hadith: ويقول عبد الله بن المبارك ت١٨١هـ: الإسناد من الدين، ولولا الإسناد لقال من شاء ما شاء().
results.context: Discussing the importance of the chain of narration (isnad) in hadith.
results.explanation: Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak states that the isnad (chain of narration) is from the religion, and without it, anyone could say whatever they wanted.

results.hadith: وعنه أيضًا: مثل الذي يطلب أمر دينه بلا إسناد كمثل الذي يرتقي السطح بلا سلم.
results.context: Discussing the importance of the chain of narration (isnad) in hadith.
results.explanation: Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak compares seeking religious knowledge without a chain of narration to climbing to a roof without a ladder.

results.hadith: والأثر رواه مسلم في المقدمة باب: بيان أن الإسناد من الدين.
results.context: Discussing the importance of the chain of narration (isnad) in hadith.
results.explanation: This refers to the hadith that states the isnad is from the religion, and it was narrated by Muslim in the introduction to his Sahih.

results.hadith: قال سبحانه وتعالى : }قُلْ إِن كُنتُمْ تُحِبُّونَ اللَّهَ فَاتَّبِعُونِي يُحْبِبْكُمُ اللَّهُ { (آل عمران: ٣١)
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah Al-Imran, 3:31), not a hadith. It states that if people love Allah, they should follow the Prophet (ﷺ), and then Allah will love them.

results.hadith: وقال : }يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ وَأُولِي الْأَمْرِ مِنْكُمْ فَإِن تَنَازَعْتُمْ فِي شَيْءٍ فَرُدُّوهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ وَالرَّسُولِ إِن كُنتُمْ تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ وَأَحْسَنُ تَأْوِيلًا (١) [النساء: ٥٩]
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah An-Nisa, 4:59), not a hadith. It commands believers to obey Allah, the Messenger, and those in authority, and to refer disputes to Allah and the Messenger.

results.hadith: قـــد قـــال : : }فَلَا وَرَبِّكَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ حَتَّىٰ يُحَكِّمُوكَ فِيمَا شَجَرَ بَيْنَهُمْ ثُمَّ لَا يَجِدُوا فِي أَنفُسِهِمْ حَرَجًا مِّمَّا قَضَيْتَ وَيُسَلِّمُوا تَسْلِيمًا (1) [النساء: ٦٥]
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah An-Nisa, 4:65), not a hadith. It states that people will not truly believe until they accept the Prophet's (ﷺ) judgment and submit to it completely.

results.hadith: وقال: }لَّقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِي رَسُولِ اللَّهِ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرْجُو اللَّهَ وَالْيَوْمَ الْآخِرَ وَذَكَرَ اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا (١) [الأحزاب: ٢١]
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah Al-Ahzab, 33:21), not a hadith. It states that the Prophet (ﷺ) is a good example for those who hope for Allah and the Last Day.

results.hadith: وقال: }وَمَا آتَاكُمُ الرَّسُولُ فَخُذُوهُ وَمَا نَهَاكُمْ عَنْهُ فَانتَهُوا وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ إِنَّ اللَّهَ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ [الحشر: ٧]
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah Al-Hashr, 59:7), not a hadith. It commands believers to take what the Messenger gives them and abstain from what he forbids.

results.hadith: وَأَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ الذِّكْرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ مَا نُزِّلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَكَ [النحل: ٤٤]
results.context: Supporting the authenticity of the Sunnah, the text quotes verses from the Quran and mentions the Prophet's (ﷺ) sayings.
results.explanation: This is a verse from the Quran (Surah An-Nahl, 16:44), not a hadith. It states that Allah revealed the Quran to the Prophet (ﷺ) so he could explain it to the people.

results.hadith: وأمر العلماء بالحديث وإظهار السنة.
results.context: Describing the actions of Al-Mutawakkil during the second Abbasid era.
results.explanation: Al-Mutawakkil ordered the scholars to focus on narrating hadith and making the Sunnah apparent.

results.hadith: يا هذِّه قد رَدَّ الله على ابنك بَصَرَهُ بكَثْرة دُعائِكُ
results.context: The context is a dream seen by the mother of Muhammad al-Bukhari, where she is told that Allah has restored her son's sight due to her prayers.
results.explanation: This is a statement made in a dream, attributed to the Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham), informing the mother of Al-Bukhari that her son's sight has been restored due to her prayers.

results.hadith: قال : فأصبح وقد ردَّ الله عليه بصره
results.context: The context is the aftermath of the dream where the mother of Muhammad al-Bukhari was told that Allah has restored her son's sight due to her prayers.
results.explanation: This is a statement describing the result of the dream, indicating that Al-Bukhari's sight was restored the next morning.

results.hadith: فقلتُ: إن أبا الزبير لم يرو عن إبراهيم.
results.context: The context is a discussion between Muhammad al-Bukhari and a scholar named Al-Nakhli regarding a chain of narration.
results.explanation: This is a statement made by Al-Bukhari, correcting a scholar's mistake in a chain of narration, stating that Abu al-Zubair did not narrate from Ibrahim.

results.hadith: فقلتُ له : أرجع إلى الأصلِ إنْ كان عِنْدك
results.context: The context is a discussion between Muhammad al-Bukhari and a scholar named Al-Nakhli regarding a chain of narration.
results.explanation: This is a statement made by Al-Bukhari, advising the scholar to check the original source of the narration.

results.hadith: قلتُ: هو الزبير بن عدي عن إبراهيم.
results.context: The context is a discussion between Muhammad al-Bukhari and a scholar named Al-Nakhli regarding a chain of narration.
results.explanation: This is a statement made by Al-Bukhari, correcting the scholar by providing the correct chain of narration.

results.hadith: صدقتَ
results.context: The context is a discussion between Muhammad al-Bukhari and a scholar named Al-Nakhli regarding a chain of narration.
results.explanation: This is a statement made by the scholar Al-Nakhli, acknowledging the correctness of Al-Bukhari's correction.

results.hadith: خرجتُ مع أمي وأخي أحمد إلى مَكَّة، فلما حججتُ رجع بها أخي، وتخلفتُ في طلبِ الحديث
results.context: The context is a biographical account of Al-Bukhari's life, describing his journey to Mecca and his subsequent pursuit of hadith collection.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari recounts that he traveled to Mecca with his mother and brother Ahmad. After performing Hajj, his brother and mother returned home, but he remained behind to seek knowledge and collect hadith.

results.hadith: الإيمان قولُ وعمل، يزيد وينقص
results.context: This is a statement attributed to hadith scholars, mentioned in the context of Al-Bukhari's travels and the people he learned from.
results.explanation: This statement describes the understanding of faith (Iman) as comprising both verbal affirmation (قول) and actions (عمل), and that it is subject to increase and decrease.

results.hadith: لم أتئتم منذ أربعين سنة
results.context: Quoting Al-Bukhari's statement about his actions.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari stated that he had not backbitten anyone for forty years.

results.hadith: ما أغتبتُ أحد قط منذ علمت أن الغيبة حرام
results.context: Quoting Al-Bukhari's statement about his actions.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari stated that he had never backbitten anyone since he learned that backbiting is forbidden.

results.hadith: كنت أستغل في كل شهر خمسمائة درهم، فأنفقها في الطلب وما عند الله خير وأبقى
results.context: Quoting Al-Bukhari's statement about his actions.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari stated that he earned 500 dirhams each month and spent it on seeking knowledge, and that what is with Allah is better and more lasting.

results.hadith: إن أخذتُ منهم كتابًا طمعوا، ولن أبيع ديني بدنياي
results.context: Quoting Al-Bukhari's statement about his actions.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari stated that if he took a document from his debtors, they would become greedy, and he would not sell his religion for the sake of worldly gain.

results.hadith: هَذا الذي ينفعني؟
results.context: Quoting Al-Bukhari's statement about his actions.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari's response when asked why he was helping to build a structure.

results.hadith: ما قدمتُ على أحدٍ إلا كان أنتفاعه بي أكثر من أنتفاعي به.
results.context: Statements of Al-Bukhari and praise for him
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari said: "I did not come to anyone except that their benefit from me was greater than my benefit from them."

results.hadith: ما أستصخرتُ نفسي عند أحدٍ إلا عند عليّ ابن المديني، وربما كنت أغْرِبُ عليه.
results.context: Statements of Al-Bukhari
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari said: "I did not belittle myself before anyone except Ali ibn al-Madini, and I would sometimes be surprised by him."

results.hadith: أحفظ مائة ألف حديث صحيح، وأحفظ مائتي ألف حديث غير صحيح.
results.context: Statements of Al-Bukhari
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari said: "I memorize one hundred thousand authentic hadith, and I memorize two hundred thousand inauthentic hadith."

results.hadith: إني أرجو أن ألقى الله ولا يحاسبني أني أغتبت أحدًا.
results.context: Statements of Al-Bukhari
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari said: "I hope to meet Allah and that He will not hold me accountable for backbiting anyone."

results.hadith: كتبت عن ألف ثقة من العلماء وزيادة، وليس عندي حديث لا أذكر إسناده
results.context: The context is a quote from Imam Bukhari about his rigorous approach to hadith collection and verification.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari states that he wrote from over a thousand trustworthy scholars and that he does not have a hadith without knowing its chain of narration.

results.hadith: كتبت عن ألف وثمانين نفسًا ليس فيهم إلا صاحب حديث
results.context: The context is a quote from Imam Bukhari about the number of narrators he collected hadith from.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari states that he wrote from 1080 people, all of whom were hadith narrators.

results.hadith: فقال البخاري لرسول الأمير: قل له إنني لا أذل العلم ولا أحمله إلى أبواب السلاطين، فإن كانت له حاجة إلى شيء منه فليحضرني في مسجدي أو في داري فإن لم يعجبك هذا فأنت سلطان، فامنعني من المجلس ليكون لي عذر عند الله يوم القيامة أني لا أكتم العلم
results.context: The context is a narration about Imam Bukhari's refusal to bring his books to the ruler of Bukhara.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari refused to take his books to the ruler, stating he would not humiliate knowledge by bringing it to the doors of rulers. He offered the ruler to come to him in the mosque or his house. If the ruler did not like this, he could prevent him from teaching so that he would have an excuse before Allah on the Day of Judgment for not concealing knowledge.

results.hadith: اللهم قد ضاقت علي الأرض بما رحبت فاقبضني إليك
results.context: Imam Bukhari's supplication before his death.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari supplicated, "O Allah, the earth has become narrow for me despite its vastness, so take me to Yourself."

results.hadith: (أرسلوني فقد ضعفت)
results.context: The context is Imam Bukhari's last moments before his death.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari said, "Release me, for I have become weak."

results.hadith: ما وضعت في "الصحيح" حديثًا إلا أغتسلت قبل ذلك وصليت ركعتين
results.context: Referring to Imam Bukhari's meticulous approach to compiling Sahih al-Bukhari.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari stated that he would perform ablution and pray two rak'ahs before including any hadith in his Sahih collection.

results.hadith: كنت عند إسحاق بن راهويه، فقال رجل لو جمعتم كتابًا مختصرًا للسنن، فوقع ذلك في قلبي، فأخذت في جمع هذا الكتاب
results.context: Explaining the motivation behind Imam Bukhari compiling Sahih al-Bukhari.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari narrates that while in the presence of Ishaq bin Rahwayh, someone suggested compiling a concise book of Sunnah, which inspired him to begin compiling his collection.

results.hadith: رأيت النبي 䍗 في المنام وأنا بين يديه أذّب عنه بمروحة في يدي، فسألت بعض المعبرين في ذلك فقال لي: أنت ذنب الكذب عن النبي 䍗
results.context: Another reason for compiling Sahih al-Bukhari, a dream.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari recounts a dream where he was fanning the Prophet (peace be upon him) and was interpreted as protecting the Prophet from lies.

results.hadith: قال شيخنا أبو عبد الله الحافظ: أروي من وجهين ثابتين عن البخاري أنه قال: (أخرجت هذا الكتاب من نحو ستمائة ألف حديث، وصنفته في ست عشرة سنة، وجعلته حجة فيما بيني وبين الله، وما أدخلت في الجامع إلا ما صح، وتركت من الصـحاح لأجل الطول).
results.context: The text discusses how Al-Bukhari compiled his Sahih collection and quotes Al-Bukhari's statement about the process.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari stated that he compiled his Sahih collection from approximately 600,000 hadiths over 16 years. He considered it a proof between himself and God, including only authentic hadiths and omitting some authentic ones to avoid excessive length.

results.hadith: روي عنه أنه قال: صنفت جميع كتبي ثلاث مرات
results.context: The text discusses Al-Bukhari's care for his works and quotes him saying he revised them three times.
results.explanation: Al-Bukhari said that he revised all his books three times.

results.hadith: كتبت عن ألف ثقة من العلماء وزيادة، وليس عندي حديث لا أذكر
results.context: Referring to Imam Bukhari's method of selecting his teachers and in his research and compilation.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari stated that he wrote from over a thousand trustworthy scholars and that he did not have a hadith that he did not remember.

results.hadith: صنفت كتاب الجامع في المسجد الحرام، وما أدخلت فيه حديثًا إلا بعدما أستخرت الله تعالى وصليت ركعتين وتيقنت صحته
results.context: Describing the location of the compilation of Sahih al-Bukhari and the process of selecting hadiths.
results.explanation: Imam Bukhari said that he compiled the book "Al-Jami" in the Masjid al-Haram (the Sacred Mosque in Mecca) and that he did not include any hadith in it except after performing Istikhara prayer (a prayer for guidance) and praying two rak'ahs (units of prayer) and being certain of its authenticity.

results.hadith: الانتصال عندهم أن يعبر كل من الرواة في روايته عن شيخه، بصيغة صريحة في السماع منه، كسمعت وحدثني وأخبرني، أو ظاهرة كعن وأن فلانًا قال
results.context: The text is explaining Al-Bukhari's methodology in hadith criticism.
results.explanation: This is a description of how narrators should transmit hadith according to Al-Bukhari, using explicit terms like "I heard," "He narrated to me," or "He informed me," or implicit terms like "from" and "that so-and-so said."

results.hadith: ورجل آتاه الله الحكمة، فهو يقضي بها ويعلمها
results.context: The text describes a righteous man.
results.explanation: A man whom Allah has given wisdom, he judges by it and teaches it.
results.completion: This is a partial hadith. A more complete version is found in various collections like Sahih al-Bukhari and Sahih Muslim. A possible completion is: "لا حسد إلا في اثنتين: رجل آتاه الله القرآن فهو يقوم به آناء الليل وآناء النهار، ورجل آتاه الله الحكمة فهو يقضي بها ويعلمها" (There is no envy except in two cases: a man whom Allah has given the Quran, so he recites it during the night and during the day, and a man whom Allah has given wisdom, so he judges by it and teaches it).

results.hadith: أن رسول اللّ خُطَب الناس يوم النحر فقال: "يا أيها الناس أي يوم هذا؟ قالوا : يوم حرام إلى أن قال : اللهم هل بلغت هل بلغت".
results.context: The hadith is presented as an example of how Al-Bukhari presents hadiths in different forms to clarify and strengthen them. It is narrated by Ibn Abbas.
results.explanation: Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) delivered a sermon on the day of sacrifice (Eid al-Adha), asking the people about the day and then saying, "O Allah, have I conveyed the message?" (repeated twice).

results.hadith: قال رسول اللّ يوم فتح مكة، إن هذا البلد حرمه الله لا يعضد شوكه ولا ينفر صيده، ولا يلتقط لقطته إلا من عرفها
results.context: Mentioned in the context of Imam Bukhari's methodology in his Sahih, specifically discussing how he presents hadiths with different isnads and matns.
results.explanation: The Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) said on the day of the conquest of Mecca: "Indeed, this city is made sacred by Allah. Its thorns should not be cut, its game should not be chased, and its lost property should not be picked up except by one who announces it."

results.hadith: وروي حديث جابر أكثر من عشرين مرة، اكنت مع النبي ﷺ في غزوة فأبطأ بي جملي وأعيا.. الحديث.
results.context: Mentioning the repetition of a hadith narrated by Jabir.
results.explanation: This refers to a hadith narrated by Jabir, where he was with the Prophet (peace be upon him) in a battle and his camel was slow and tired. The text indicates that this hadith was narrated more than twenty times.
results.completion: The full hadith is not provided. A complete version would include the full text of the narration.

results.hadith: وروي حديث عائشة : "أن النبي ﷺ أشترىْ طعامًا من يهودي إلى أجل ورهنه درعًا من حديد؛
results.context: Mentioning a hadith narrated by Aisha.
results.explanation: This is a hadith narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) stating that the Prophet (peace be upon him) bought food from a Jew on credit and pledged an iron shield as collateral.
results.completion: The full hadith is not provided. A complete version would include the full text of the narration.

results.hadith: وأكثر من روىْ عنه من الصحابة أبو هريرة 䍗.
results.context: Mentioning Abu Hurairah as a frequent narrator.
results.explanation: This statement indicates that Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated the most hadiths from the Prophet (peace be upon him).

results.hadith: قال القاضي عياض في "المشارق": أكثر الرواة عندنا من طريق الفربري والنسفي، ولم يصل إلينا من غير هذين الطريقين عنه ولا دخل المغرب والأندلس إلا عنهما، علىُ كثرة رواة البخاري عنه لكتابه
results.context: Mentioning the statement of Qadi 'Iyad regarding the most common narrations of Sahih al-Bukhari in the Maghreb.
